edu.dynamic.dynamiz.structure

Class MyDateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.dynamic.dynamiz.structure.MyDate
      • edu.dynamic.dynamiz.structure.MyDateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MyDate>

    public class MyDateTime
extends MyDate
    Defines an object containing both date and time. Time is defined using 24-hour clock. Constructor MyDateTime() //Creates a new instance of MyDateTime using the default date and time values. MyDateTime(int date, int month, int year) //Creates a new date instance. MyDateTime(int date, int month, int year, int hour, int minute) //Creates a new date and time instance. MyDateTime(MyDate date) //Downcasting constructor for MyDate objects. MyDateTime(Date date) //Creates a MyDateTime instance from the given Date object for storage purpose. Public Methods int getHour() //Gets the hour field of this date time object. int getMinute() //Gets the minute field of this date time object. static boolean isValidTime(int hour, int minute) //Checks if the given time is valid. static MyDateTime makeDateTime(String dateString) //Creates a new MydateTime object from the given date and time string. void setDateTime(int date, int month, int year, int hour, int minute) //Sets the new value of date and time. void setTime(int hour, int minute) //Sets the time of this date time object. String toString() //Gets the String rerpesentation of this date time object.

        Creates a new DateTime object with the specified date and time details.
        Parameters:
        date - The day of the month.
        month - The month of the year.
        year - The year.
        hour - The hour of the day in 24-hour clock.
        minute - The minute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the date and time is invalid on the calendar of 24-hour clock.

    • Method Detail

      • makeDateTime

        public static MyDateTime makeDateTime(java.lang.String dateString)
        Creates a DateTime instance from the given date string.
        Parameters:
        dateString - The string representation of the DateTiem object to make.
        Returns:
        A DateTime instance such that calling toString().equals(dateString) returns true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either the date and/or the time is invalid.

        public static boolean isValidTime(int hour,
                                  int minute)
        Checks if the given time is valid.
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour of the day.
        minute - The minute.
        Returns:
        True if the given time is in the range [00:00, 23:59] and false otherwise.

      • compareIncludingTime

        public int compareIncludingTime(MyDate other)
        Comparing the date. If the dates differ at the date level then return the result. Otherwise, compare the time level.
        Overrides:
        compareIncludingTime in class MyDate
        Parameters:
        other - The date to be compared with. It can be MyDate or MyDateTime instance
        Returns:
        same result as compareTo() will
